Module lanej.inventorysystem
Package lanej.inventorysystem.controller

Class AddProduct

java.lang.Object
lanej.inventorysystem.controller.AddProduct
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProduct extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The AddProduct class is responsible for managing the user interface and functionality of the Add Product screen in the inventory management system. This class implements the Initializable interface from the JavaFX API. It contains text fields, tables, and buttons for adding the details of a new product, including its associated parts. The class allows users to search, add, and remove parts from the associated parts table, as well as save and cancel the addition of this new product.
Author:
Jonathan Lane

  • Constructor Details

    • AddProduct

      public AddProduct()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called by the FXMLLoader when the add-product.fxml file is loaded. It sets the initial values for all the fields in the screen, and populates the parts table. It also initializes the sorting and filtering functionality for both the all parts table and the associated parts table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL used to initialize the controller.
      resourceBundle - The ResourceBundle used to initialize the controller.

    • addButton

      public void addButton()
      This method is called when the user presses the "Add Part Association" button. It adds the Part association to the Product object that would be added to Inventory if the user clicks "Save" afterward. If the same Part is already associated with the Product for whatever reason, it asks the user to confirm before adding the duplicate Part.

    • removeButton

      public void removeButton()
      This method is called whenever the user clicks the "Remove Part Association" button. It will ask the user for confirmation before calling Product.deleteAssociatedPart(productToAdd). It only does this if the user has selected an item within the Associated Parts table, otherwise it doesn't do anything.

    • saveButton

      public void saveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called whenever the user clicks the "Save" button. There exist many try and catch blocks within this method due to the need to check and notify the user of exactly what is wrong with their input, if anything. Ultimately, this method attempts to obtain the user input for all the editable TextFields within this screen (not counting the search fields), and parse that information into the data for the creation of a new Product (that is then added to Inventory). It gets the new Product's ID from InventoryApplication.nextProductId().
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that is created from the Save button within the scene

    • cancelButton

      public void cancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called whenever the user clicks the "Cancel" button. it simply directs the user back to the Main Screen, without saving any info that may have been created in the other actions of the scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that is created from the Cancel button within the scene
